$ZIM Posted this on a gentleman's post below
created_at: but thought it could help some people understand the bear case. It's not that complicated; Supply is ridiculous. Can play all these games like global recession
column8: but if you have an abundance of supply most shipping companies will end up losing money. The stocks do not price past earnings
column9: they price future earnings. It's probable that future earnings will be bad until enough scrapping takes place to balance the fleet. This process usually takes a minimum of a few years
column10: often much much longer. The cash on the balance sheet might be enough to last until the next bull cycle

column3: and all the environmental regulations will do more than even the most bullish shipping CEO claims. GL."
